news_header: Trump signs order reversing Biden's plastic straw replacement initiative, citing paper straws' ineffectiveness.
news_original_title: Trump signs order shifting US back toward plastic straws
news_text: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order that ends the government's initiative to replace plastic straws with paper ones, reversing a measure implemented by former President Joe Biden. Trump criticized paper straws for being ineffective and called for a nationwide strategy to eliminate them. This order comes as part of a broader debate on plastic pollution, with Biden's administration previously planning to phase out single-use plastics by 2027. Trump, who sold branded plastic straws during his campaign, has been a long-time critic of paper straws, claiming they dissolve quickly and do not perform well.
